meanings.definition: Blebbings (noun): small, rounded protrusions on the surface of a cell
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, I observed tiny blebbings on the cell.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the blebbings to understand cell structure.
meanings.sent3: The blebbings on the cell looked like tiny bumps on a road.
meanings.sent4: Her skin resembled a field of blebbings, each one unique and important.
meanings.sent5: The blebbings on the cell were like little buttons, each serving a specific purpose.

meanings.definition: Blebbings (verb): the act of forming small, rounded protrusions on the surface of a cell
meanings.sent1: Cells blebbings when they need to adapt to their environment.
meanings.sent2: The process of blebbings helps cells respond to external stimuli.
meanings.sent3: The cell decided to start blebbings to stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity blebbings like bubbles, bringing new ideas to the surface.
meanings.sent5: The city streets blebbings with life, each person adding a unique touch.
